All Classes

Class
Description
ActionBar
An action bar is a subclass of a bar used for selecting and placing down units in the game's playing field.
Bar
A bar is a non-clickable, superclass object that is placed at the bottom of the playing field and is used to group Buttons together that perform special functions such as placing down a tile or a unit.
Button
A button is a clickable object that interacts with the mouse listener to run certain functions when hovering and releasing the mouse.
All button objects inherit the same color, border, font, and center text alignment.
Constants
This class is a collection of in-game numeric values used for game balance and difficulty but converted to a readable format for future authors.
Constants.Direction
Defines the current direction, used in pathfinding and setting the velocity of an enemy,
Constants.Enemies
Defines the type of enemy as well as its speed, maximum health, and reward when killed.
Constants.Projectiles
Defines each projectile including their owner, special properties, and speed.
Constants.Tiles
Defines the type of tile, used in enemy pathfinding and placing down a unit in the playing field.
Constants.Units
Defines each unit including their name, information, flavor, base range, and base cooldown.
Editing
An editing game scene is a subclass of a game scene that facilitates the editing and modification of level tiles.
Enemy
An enemy is a superclass object that moves around the level from a defined start flag to an end flag both faciliated by the EnemyManager and WaveManager.
An enemy interacts with a unit or projectile to recieve damage and debuffs depending on the source.
EnemyManager
Facilitates the rendering and pathfinding of enemies.
Flag
A flag is an object that can be placed above tiles to indicate the start and end points of a level.
Game
The main class of the project responsible for creating a new instance of the game.
GameOver
An game over game scene is a subclass of a game scene that facilitates the resetting of the playing game scene when an end game condition is met such as finishing all waves in a map or when all lives of the player has been lost.
GameScene
A game scene is a superclass object that facilitates the rendering and animation of tiles across different subclasses, allows interaction of the mouse with other game objects such as buttons, and allows interacting with the main game class depending on the current game state.
A subclass inheriting a game scene implements a set of pre-defined methods in SceneMethods related to rendering objects to the screen and listening for mouse events.
GameScreen
A set of methods related to creating, interacting, and drawing to the game screen.
GameStates
Enumerates all possible game states which is used for detecting game logic, rendering, user interface, and other objects related to that game state.
KeyboardInput
Listens for keyboard input and runs the appropriate function related to the input.
Used for listening when the player presses ESCAPE when playing which removes the currently displayed or selected unit.
LoadSave
This class is responsible for handling external game resources such as reading and writing level files to the system, and loading in images for the game's icon, background and asset sprites.
MathFunctions
This class is responsible for handling mathematical operations such as calculating the distance of two objects for range calculations and for converting the dimensions of arrays when reading and writing level files.
Menu
An menu game scene is a subclass of a game scene that facilitates the the changing of different game states and moving across different game scenes.
MouseInput
Listens for mouse movement and input and runs the appropriate function related to the input.
Used for listening for LMB when clicking on buttons, clicking on units when playing, and clicking on tiles when editing.
Used for listening to mouse movement and detecting which unit or tile to select based on the current position of the mouse.
Playing
A playing game scene is a subclass of a game scene that facilitates the game loop.
Projectile
A projectile is a superclass that interacts with any enemy to reduce their health and apply enemy effects.
A projectile is created from a unit when it is off cooldown and when an enemy is within range.
ProjectileManager
Facilitates the rendering, adding, and removing of projectiles in the playing field.
Render
Calls the appropriate render method of the current scene based on the current game state.
SceneMethods
Defines a default set of methods that are required to be implemented by all subclasses inheriting game scenes.
Settings
An settings game scene is a subclass of a game scene is a future use scene for adjusting the settings, currently being used by the author as acknowledgement to all the players currently playing the game.
SlimeBlue
A Blue Slime (Level 2 Slime) is a subclass of an Enemy with 250 health and 27 movement speed.
SlimeGreen
A Green Slime (Level 1 Slime) is a subclass of an Enemy with 100 health and 36 movement speed.
SlimePurple
A Purple Slime (Level 4 Slime) is a subclass of an Enemy with 1,562 health and 15.12 movement speed.
SlimeRed
A Red Slime (Level 3 Slime) is a subclass of an Enemy with 625 health and 20.28 movement speed.
SlimeWhite
A White Slime (Level 5 Slime) is a subclass of an Enemy with 3,906 health and 11.40 movement speed.
Tile
A tile is a superclass that represents the grid system of the game and interacts with game logic such as if a unit is able to be placed or if an enemy can pathfind to the set location.
A tile in a location can be edited using the game's built-in level editor or by using pre-defined level files.
TileManager
Facilitates the rendering of tiles.
ToolBar
A toolbar is a subclass of a bar used for selecting and placing down tiles in the game's built-in level editor.
Unit
A unit is a superclass object that interacts with any enemy to prevent it from reaching the end of the level.
UnitManager
Facilitates the rendering, targeting, placing, deleting and other methods related to interacting with units.
Wave
A wave is an integer array list whose elements are the enemy types.
Waves are constructed in the WaveManager and are used for spawning defined enemy types in short intervals when a new wave is started in the game.
WaveManager
Facilitates the spawning of waves or groups of enemies in set intervals.
